div.p: This old motherly woman, who brings this letter, has often asked me to give her a letter of recommendation to you, and in the end, I could not refuse her. She claims to be a Bullinger on her mother's side, and she had a poor, miserable husband, Joachim Gochlinger, who treated her badly and left her without a penny or anything of value. The good woman would like to return to her brother in Mellingen, with whom she is in disfavor, and she kindly asks you to write a note to him for God's sake, hoping that this will help her to appear more favorably in her brother's eyes. Kind sir and godfather, you would be doing a great act of charity if you could assist and advise this poor, old, distressed woman. May God reward you for this.
With this, I commend you to God.
Given in Chur on the 1st of February, in the year 1558.
To the honorable, well-learned Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, pastor at the Grossmünster in Zürich, his kind lord, to respond.
